name: Rhus toxicodendron
Relationship: Compare: RHUS RADICANS (almost identical action); characteristics are, burning in tongue, tip feels sore, pains are often semilateral and in various parts, often remote and successive. Many symptoms are better after a storm has thoroughly set in, especially after an electric storm. Has pronounced YEARLY aggravation. (LACHES.) RHUS RADICANS has headache in OCCIPUT even pain in nape of neck and from there pains draw over the head FORWARDS). RHUS DIVERSILOBA - California Poison-oak (antidote to Rhus; violent skin symptoms, with frightful itching; much swelling of face, hands and genitals; skin very sensitive; eczema and erysipelas, great nervous weakness, tired from least effort; goes to sleep from sheer exhaustion); XEROPHYLLUM (dysmenorrhoea and skin symptoms). Compare, also: ARN.; BAPT.; LACH.; ARS.; HYOS.; OP. (stupefactions more profound). MIMOSA - Sensitive Plant - (rheumatism, knee stiff, lancinating pains in back and limbs. Swelling of ankles. Legs tremble).Complementary: BRY.; CALC. FLUOR. PHYTOL. (Rheumatism). In urticaria follow with BOVISTA.Inimical: APIS.Antidotes: Bathing with milk and Grindelia lotion very effective. AMPELOPSIS TRIFOLIA - Three-leaf Woodbine - (Toxic dermatitis due to vegetable poisons - 30 and 200. Very similar to Rhus poisoning. Desensitizing against Ivy poisoning by the use of ascending doses of the tincture by mouth or by hypodermic injections is recommended by old school authorities, but is not as effective as the homeopathic remedies especially RHUS 30 and 200 and ANACARD., etc. ANACARD.; CROTON.; GRINDELIA; MEZER.; CYP RIP.; PLUMBAGO (eczema of vulva); GRAPH.
Modalities: Worse: wet rainy weather and after rain; at night
Worse: when lying on back or right side

Urine: Dark, turbid, high-colored, scanty urine, with white sediment
Head: Humid eruptions on scalp; itching greatly
Feels as if a board were strapped on the forehead
Scalp sensitive; worse on side lain on
Pain in forehead and proceeds thence backward
Heavy head
Headache in occiput ; painful to touch
Brain feels loose and as if struck against skull on walking or rising
Vertigo when rising
Fever: Intermittent; chill, with dry cough and restlessness
Typhoid; tongue dry and brown; sordes; bowels loose; great restlessness
Chilly, as if cold water were poured over him, followed by heat and inclination to stretch the limbs
Stomach: Great thirst, with dry mouth and throat
Want of appetite for any kind of food, with unquenchable thirst
Nausea, vertigo, and bloated abdomen after eating
Abdomen: Pain in region of ascending colon
Violent pains, relieved by lying on abdomen
Rumbling of flatus on first rising, but disappears with continued motion
Mouth: Corners of mouth ulcerated; fever-blisters around mouth and chin
Tongue red and cracked; coated, except red triangular space at the tip; dry and red at edges
Teeth feel loose and long; gums sore
Rectum: Dysentery, with tearing pains down thighs
Diarrhoea of blood, slime, and reddish mucus
Will often abort a beginning suppurative process near the rectum
Respiratory: Bronchial coughs in old people, worse on awaking and with expectoration of small plugs of mucus
Dry, teasing cough from midnight until morning, during a chill, or when putting hands out of bed
Oppression of the chest, cannot get breath with sticking pains
Influenza, with aching in all bones
Hemoptysis from over exertion; blood bright red
Eyes: Eye painful on turning it or pressing, can hardly move it, as in acute retrobulbar neuritis
Iritis, after exposure to cold and dampness, and of rheumatic origin
Photophobia; profuse flow of yellow pus
Profuse gush of hot, scalding tears upon opening lids

Nose: Tip of nose red, sore, ulcerated

Ears: Pain in ears, with sensation as if something were in them

Trembling and palpitation when sitting still
Mind: Extreme restlessness, with continued change of position
Great apprehension at night, cannot remain in bed
Delirium, with fear of being poisoned
Back: Pain and stiffness in small of back; better, motion, or lying on something hard; worse, while sitting
Stiffness of the nape of the neck

Menses early, profuse, and prolonged, acrid
Pelvic articulations stiff when beginning to move

Vesicles, herpes; urticaria; pemphigus; erysipelas; vesicular suppurative forms
Extremities: Rheumatic pains spread over a large surface at nape of neck, loins, and extremities; better motion
Loss of power in forearm and fingers; crawling sensation in the tips of fingers
Sciatica; worse, cold, damp weather, at night
Numbness and formication, after overwork and exposure
Pains tearing in tendons, ligaments, and fascia

details: The effects on the skin, rheumatic pains, mucous membrane affections, and a typhoid type of fever, make this remedy frequently indicated. Rhus affects fibrous tissue markedly - joints, tendons, sheaths - aponeurosis, etc., producing pains and stiffness. Post-operative complications. TEARING ASUNDER PAINS. Motion always limbers up the Rhus patient, and hence he feels better for a time from a change of position. Ailments from strains, over-lifting, getting wet while perspiring. Septic conditions. Cellulitis and infections, carbuncles in early stages. (ECHINAC.) Rheumatism in the cold season. SEPTICAEMIA.
dosage: Sixth to thirtieth potency. The 200th and higher are antidotal to poisoning with the plant and tincture.
